news.title: Karnataka deputy CM launches online building plan approval for Bengaluru
news.para: Revolutionary online building plan approval process for construction of buildings in sites up to 4000 square feet in city civic body Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) limits.

news.title: Union cabinet approves transfer of 256 acres of salt pan land for Dharavi redevelopment project
news.para: The Union cabinet has sanctioned the transfer of 256 acres of salt pan land in Mumbai to the Maharashtra government, promoting the Dharavi Redevelopment project. This land will support a rental housing scheme aimed at aiding ineligible slum dwellers of Dharavi. The state will recoup the land’s market price from Dharavi Redevelopment Project Private Limited.

news.title: New notices for GST on leasehold land transfers stir real estate concerns
news.para: The Goods & Services Tax (GST) authorities have recently issued these notices concerning the transfer of leasehold land. The crux of the issue lies in whether the transfer of leasehold land constitutes a sale of land or a service.

news.title: EBCO's promoter buys apartment in Mumbai's Worli for Rs 115 crore
news.para: The deal values the apartment at nearly Rs 1.62 lakh per sq ft basis the carpet area spread over 7,139 sq ft, making it one of the most expensive residential property transactions anywhere in the country.

news.title: Central government amends guidelines for transfer of salt lands
news.para: ​​ As per the revised guidelines, the land can be allocated for welfare measures, such as slum re-development, affordable housing and PM-Awas Yojana, and for the purpose of schools and colleges, lands can be transferred to CPSEs (central public sector enterprises), states and their enterprises at 25 per cent of the circle rate.

news.title: Sebi puts JSW Cement's Rs 4,000 crore IPO on hold
news.para: The proposed IPO consists of a new issue of equity shares worth Rs 2,000 crore and an offer-for-sale (OFS) of Rs 2,000 crore by investor shareholders, according to the draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) filed with the regulator.

news.title: Sebi chief refrains from commenting on real estate investment trusts
news.para: Speaking at an event organised by industry body CII, Buch said," If I utter the word REITs, I am accused of conflict of interest".

news.title: Omaxe Group to invest Rs 2,500 crore to develop commercial-cum-sports complex in Delhi
news.para: Spread over 50.4 acre, the project is being developed in partnership with the Delhi Development Authority (DDA) under a public-private partnership (PPP) model.

news.title: Regency Ceramics enters into leasing agreement with Segno Ceramics
news.para: Regency Ceramics will pay monthly lease rentals and has two years time to decide on acquisition of the company.

news.title: Australia's REA Group considers buying UK-based Rightmove
news.para: Shares in London-listed Rightmove surged 24% to 6.89 pounds, their highest level since March 2022, and the stock was the top percentage gainer on the FTSE 100 index. The company declined to comment.

news.title: Blackstone’s Horizon Industrial Parks to manage government's logistics assets
news.para: These assets have a development potential of 2.4 million sq ft and the investment is expected to be around Rs 700 crore.

news.title: Landmark Group plans to invest Rs 4,200 crore in residential and commercial projects
news.para: The company’s plans to launch a group housing project along the Dwarka Expressway and a high-street project in New Gurugram. Both these projects are expected to be launched by the end of this year.

news.title: Allahabad HC directs Noida authority to maintain status quo in Wajidpur demolition
news.para: The order came as a response to a petition filed by a group of landowners from Wajidpur village challenging a notice issued by the Authority on 23 July 2024.

news.title: Belagavi civic body faces financial crisis due to land acquisition errors
news.para: The situation has arisen due to errors made by former officials during their administrative tenure. It is anticipated that the BCC will need to pay over Rs 100 crore in compensation to landowners.

news.title: Noida DM urges neighboring states officials to address illegal mineral transportation
news.para: "In the communication, we have urged the respective DMs to initiate a targeted campaign in their jurisdictions to address illegal mineral transportation and overloading of vehicles. We have also requested that they take necessary measures against the vehicles engaging in such unlawful activities, particularly those entering our region," said the DM.

news.title: Goa's coastal zone management authority directs demolition of multiple structures in Taleigao
news.para: The GCZMA, on receiving the complaint, inspected the site and found ‘several violations’.

news.title: Chennai metro plans commercial developments around key phase-two stations
news.para: Properties in Thirumangalam, Alandur, Vadapalani, KK Nagar, Mandaveli, Anna Nagar West, Thousand Lights, and Koyambedu have been identified for commercial development.

news.title: Government buildings in Delhi directed to install rainwater harvesting system by September 30
news.para: RWH is a technique of collecting and storing rainwater into natural reservoirs or tanks, or the infiltration of surface water into the subsurface level. These pits are actually soak pits, and during the rainy season, rainwater is collected through them. Thereafter, water penetrates into the ground, which increases the level of groundwater.

news.title: Goa's town planning department to revert illegally converted hill slopes
news.para: “What was a steep hill has been converted, which we are now trying to revert. All slopes, which are beyond 25% gradient now we will zone them as no development areas. I have already taken a decision and we are going step-by-step,” Rane told TOI.

news.title: Godrej Properties buys two group housing plots in Gurugram for Rs 515 crore
news.para: The land parcels together will offer a development potential of over 1 million sq ft and an estimated revenue potential of over Rs 3,400 crore.
